overview: With nearly 20 years of experience in the private equity industry, Tim Dugan has completed more than $3 billion of transactions in healthcare and life sciences companies. Prior to founding Water Street, Tim was a partner with First Chicago Equity Capital, where he was instrumental in establishing and building One Equity Partners, the $5.5 billion private equity arm of JP Morgan Chase (a predecessor of First Chicago). Tim is the Chairman of Facet Technologies and Alpine Biomed, and a Director of Lakewood Pathology. He is a former Director of Medex (Chairman), Kendro Laboratory Products, AbilityOne (Chairman), Inovision, LifeStream International, M~Wave (NASDAQ), Daka International (NASDAQ), DMAC, Central States Network and Integration Alliance Corporation. Tim received bachelor’s degrees in Economics and Electrical Engineering from Stanford University, and his M.B.A. from the University of Chicago Graduate School of Business.

degrees.institution: University of Chicago Graduate School of Business
